item.title: Spotify’s music videos are coming to more subscribers — but not in the US, yet
item.description:
Spotify is rolling out the beta test of music videos to 85 additional markets globally, allowing Premium subscribers to watch a “limited catalog” of videos from artists like Charlie XCX, Doja Cat, Ed Sheeran, Fontaines D.C., LISA, and more.

However, that list of available areas doesn’t include the US yet, and it’s unclear when it will reach us here. “As with all of our features, availability can vary across markets and tiers,” Spotify spokesperson Brittany Le Roy said in a statement to The Verge. “Music videos on Spotify are still in beta and we look forward to bringing it to even more users across more markets, including the US, in the future.”

With the wider rollout, Spotify is also adding the ability to instantly switch between audio...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Emma Roth

item.title: Microsoft’s new Xbox Series X models have a smaller chip and different cooling
item.description:
Microsoft’s discless Xbox Series X goes on sale today, and while it looks slightly different on the outside thanks to a white paint job and lack of a disc drive, inside it has been redesigned. Microsoft has redesigned the motherboard on the white Xbox Series X and new 2TB models, shrunk the chip down to 6nm, and switched to a new cooling solution.

YouTuber Austin Evans spotted the changes in a teardown of the new models, and reports that the shrunken chip allows the new Xbox Series X models to run around 10 watts less than the original model at idle.

The motherboard on the...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Tom Warren

item.title: Chip firm ASML shares fall 15% on disappointing sales outlook in surprise earnings release
item.description: ASML published its third-quarter earnings Tuesday, a day earlier than expected.

item.title: New York Times' "Cease And Desist" Notice To AI Startup Over Content Use
item.description: The New York Times has sent generative AI startup Perplexity a "cease and desist" notice demanding the company stop using its content, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.

item.title: California Cops Are Finding Out Teslas Are 'Nearly Unusable' As Police Cruises
Winter is coming: Upgrade to a refurbished Amazon Smart Thermostat for under $35
item.description: Amazon Prime members can get a refurbished Amazon Smart Thermostat for just $34.99, down from the normal refurbished price of $69.99. That's a savings of $35.

item.title: The bass-forward Sony ULT headphones are 26% off
item.description: We love the Sony ULT headphones for their booming sound that puts other headphones to shame. But we really love their discounted price of $148.
